intro: Eriospermum breviscapum, commonly known as the short-horned eriosperm, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Its small, hairy leaves and showy yellow flowers make it distinctive in its habitat. It is often found in open woodlands and along rocky outcrops.
